titles.title: Federal Prisoner Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 1987

A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to require drug testing for individuals to be released on bail, and appropriate conditions of release in the case of those individuals found to be using illegal drugs.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.

term.name: Treatment and rehabilitation of narcotic addicts

bill.summary: 6/23/1987--Introduced. Federal Prisoner Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal criminal code to require mandatory drug testing for individuals released from custody pending trial. Conditions the release of any individual whose test results indicate the use of illegal drugs upon treatment deemed appropriate by the judicial officer.
